intro: Poranthera alpina, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Poranthera alpina has small, hairy leaves and produces showy blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in open meadows and along stream banks at high elevations.
